'''Gold''' is a [[metal]] found in the [[Overworld]] and [[the Nether]]. It [[World generation|generate]]s naturally as [[gold ore]], and [[nether gold ore]], which can be smelted into [[gold ingot]]s. The gold ingots can be crafted into blocks, items, [[tool]]s, and [[armor]]. Gold can also be used to [[barter]] with [[piglin]]s and craft [[golden carrot]]s, one of the most nourishing [[food]]s in the game.

== ''Minecraft'' ==
=== Items ===
* {{ItemLink|Raw Gold}} - an item that drops from gold ore when mined; it can be smelted into gold ingots.
* {{ItemLink|Gold Ingot}} - an item created by smelting gold ore, nether gold ore, raw gold, or crafting using gold nuggets; it is used for crafting items such as [[netherite ingot]]s, dropped by [[zombified piglin]]s.
* {{ItemLink|Gold Nugget}} - an item that can be crafted into a gold ingot. Obtained by killing zombified piglins, smelting gold equipment (see {{Slink||Gear and tools}}) in a [[furnace]], or mining [[nether gold ore]] or [[gilded blackstone]].
* {{ItemLink|Golden Apple}} - a food item, crafted from gold ingots and an apple that gives the player [[Absorption]] and [[Regeneration]].
* {{ItemLink|Enchanted Golden Apple}} - a powerful food item that cannot be crafted, and can only be found as [[loot]]. It gives the player Absorption, Regeneration, [[Resistance]], and [[Fire Resistance]].
* {{ItemLink|Golden Carrot}} - a very nourishing [[food]] item, crafted from gold nuggets and a [[carrot]] together. It is used for brewing.
* {{ItemLink|Glistering Melon Slice}} - an inedible item, crafted from gold nuggets and a [[melon slice]]. It is also used for brewing.
* {{ItemLink|Clock}} - an item that displays the current [[Daylight cycle|time]] in-game.

=== Blocks ===
* {{BlockLink|Gold Ore}} - an uncommon ore found deep underground. It is more common underneath [[Badlands]].
* {{BlockLink|Deepslate Gold Ore}} - a variant of gold ore found in the [[deepslate]] layer of the world.
* {{BlockLink|Nether Gold Ore}} - a variant of gold ore that drops only nuggets when mined without [[Silk Touch]].
* {{BlockLink|Gilded Blackstone}} - a variant of [[blackstone]] that usually drops as itself, but occasionally drops as gold nuggets.
* {{BlockLink|Block of Raw Gold}} - a block used for compact raw gold storage.
* {{BlockLink|Block of Gold}} - a block used for compact gold storage.
* {{BlockLink|Bell}} - a block that produces sound when used. Can be purchased by [[trading]] with an armorer, toolsmith, or weaponsmith.
* {{BlockLink|Powered Rail}} - a type of [[rail]] made with gold ingots.
* {{BlockLink|Light Weighted Pressure Plate}} - a pressure plate made of gold. Useful for measuring how many entities are in a given space.
* {{BlockLink|Gold|link=Gold (element)}} - an element included in {{el|education}}.

=== April Fools ===
Blocks and items that appeared only in [[April Fools' Day joke]] versions containing gold textures, but not necessarily made of gold. They are:

* {{BlockLink|Golden Chest}} - a joke chest added in the [[23w13a_or_b]] snapshot.
* {{ItemLink|Golden Poisonous Potato}}, a variant of potato added in [[24w14potato]].
* {{ItemLink|Enchanted Golden Poisonous Potato}}, a variant of the golden poisonous potato.
* {{BlockLink|Potone Gold Ore}}, a variant of gold ore added in the same snapshot.
